content.description: This climbs the central crack system, starting left of "Short Crack".
content.protection: Pro 1/2" to 3", bolted anchor on top (big Metolius rap hangers).

content.description: Climb a crack to 1 or 2 bolts on a face (2 bolt anchor) This is on Hodgepodge Rock, South Face, up and right of the routes in the Guide.
content.protection: small to med trad pro, and a couple of QDs for the bolts.
content.location: Up and right of the rest of the climbs in the guidebooks.

content.description: Climb steep double cracks in a right facing corner near the right side of the wall.

Done as an on-sight solo first ascent, this route climbs a clean chocolate brown (hence the name) patina face with no protection. The crux is a bit of smearing down low while higher nice edges appear that are a bit more secure. Perhaps best done as a toprope or treated as a highball boulder problem.
Going straight to the bolt requires attention but it could be approached from the left if you don't mind the cats claw tree. Decent route up the face with smearing and using the crack to the left.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Look for the cats claw on the right and the route follows the bolt line to the left.

content.description: Pull up to the main face to find the "high" first bolt. After that follow the bolt line up. Pretty good for the grade and can't beat the easy approach.
content.protection: Bolts to a bolt and glue-in anchor.
content.location: From the center of this side of Hodgepodge cave under the rock to reach the right side of this face. Kind of hard to see from a distance but easy to spot once you're past the leaning boulder.

content.description: Follows obvious line of five bolts on the far left side of SW face of Hodgepodge Rock.
content.protection: Five bolts to a two bolt anchor.

content.description:
This route is on the Southwest face (away from the road) and is pretty fun. A decent easy/moderate climb if in the area. Nothing spectacular...

Optional small cam placements at the start on

Hedgehog

, then a possible 2" cam before the very top, after which you can veer right across to the anchor with rings above

Hedgehog

Start in a right-leaning crack/ramp, left of the start for

Hogback

. Climb up, crossing

Hogback

and follow a crack/groove to the top.
Fun steep moves with ledgeyÂ rests. Slab crux up high going direct to the last bolt.
content.location: On the broken darker tower up and right of the southwest face

content.description: this route is not really that much fun to do unless you plan on doing most if not all on this formation... it is short and uneventful. I rope soloed via TR on it today. After doing the actual route, go straight up for an additionl bit of fun. There is a walk up from the right of the formation that can be a bit tricky if you plan on TRing the route(s)... There are different sets of anchors that line the top... (It is becoming a rather OVERBOLTED formation lately)..it is easy enough to build your own anchors...
content.protection: Small to medium pro for route and anchors (There are two bolts oddly distant from each other that can be used with long webbing/cord in order to TR or build your own anchor in a horizontal crack system right off the edge on top...

climbs.name: Bittersweet
climbs.fa: Bill Todd and John Nye, January1987

content.description: This climbs the face to the right of "Short Crack", past two bolts.

climbs.name: Bakersfield Bomb
climbs.fa: (TR) unknown  FL: Bill Todd & Laurent Mounoud 1/87

content.description: this is a face route that is OK and as with the others on this formation not that spectacular. But worthwhile if in the area or just wanting to do a shorter face route for some reason. There are a few easy to moderates on this rock and one can bang them off in a heartbeat if "ticking" off routes...I would not go out of my way however....
content.protection: two bolts, anchors (?), walk off or rap
